newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Four killed, five wounded in bomb blast in Karachi.
newsitem.headline: Four killed, five wounded in bomb blast in Karachi.

text.p: At least four people, were killed, three of them children, and five wounded on Saturday in a bomb blast in Pakistan's troubled port city of Karachi, ambulance and hospital sources said.
Police said the explosion occurred in front of a house in the congested Sherabad district, killing three children aged seven, eight and 12. The fourth victim remained unidentified.
Five people, including two women, were wounded.
"It was a bomb blast. That's all we know at present," a police officer said.
An official of the private Edhi ambulance service said ambulance volunteers had reported that something was thrown in front of a house where children were playing.
No group immediately claimed responsibility for the blast and there was no word on the motive behind it.
More than 120 people have been killed in ethnic, political and sectarian violence in Karachi this year, compared to 500 in 1996 and more than 2,000 in 1995.
